page.title: 14VICTORIA HOSPITAL,LICHFIELD.
page.content: Lichfield Victoria Hospital was built in 1933 on a site known as "The glorious sweep of the Friary Estate". Still evidenced today by the pleasant grounds which surround the hospital. Funds were originally given from the Queen Victoria Jubilee Celebrations in 1887 and a small premises was opened as a private nursing home. It was later extended, and was known as Lichfield Victoria Nursing Home and Cottage Hospital. Today the Vic as it is known by local people has 36 beds - male and female - and children - plus 12 maternity beds. It also houses a casualty department, several clinics and a dialysis unit. The hospital comes under the North Birmingham Health Authority and is a community hospital run by general practitioners. Approximately 80 staff are employed.
